SEARCH
Package presentation

Class View

java.lang.Object
presentation.View
public class View extends Object
The View class manages the graphical user interface components for handling clients, products, and orders in a desktop application.

  • Method Details

    • setupTablePanel

      public void setupTablePanel(List<?> items, String panelTitle, JTable table)
      Sets up a table panel using a list of items. Reflects to determine column names from object fields.
      Parameters:
      items - the list of items to be displayed in the table
      panelTitle - the title of the panel
      table - the table to initialize

    • getViewBillsButton

      public JButton getViewBillsButton()
      Retrieves the button used to view bills. This button is typically used in the context of viewing client orders.
      Returns:
      the button used to view bills.

    • getClientFrame

      public JFrame getClientFrame()
      Retrieves the frame that contains the client management interface.
      Returns:
      the frame for client management.

    • getProductFrame

      public JFrame getProductFrame()
      Retrieves the frame that contains the product management interface.
      Returns:
      the frame for product management.

    • getOrderFrame

      public JFrame getOrderFrame()
      Retrieves the frame that contains the order management interface.
      Returns:
      the frame for order management.

    • getClientTable

      public JTable getClientTable()
      Retrieves the table used to display client information.
      Returns:
      the table displaying clients.

    • getProductTable

      public JTable getProductTable()
      Retrieves the table used to display product information.
      Returns:
      the table displaying products.

    • getOrderTable

      public JTable getOrderTable()
      Retrieves the table used to display order information.
      Returns:
      the table displaying orders.

    • initializeComboBoxes

      public void initializeComboBoxes(List<Client> clients, List<Product> products)
      This method is retained for compatibility reasons and is not used in this updated approach. In previous versions, it was used to initialize combo boxes with client and product data.
      Parameters:
      clients - a list of clients used to populate client-related UI components.
      products - a list of products used to populate product-related UI components.
